sub_title: EU Funding Advisor | Grant Writer | Scientific Communication | Let's connect!
summary:
I am an enthusiastic funding advisor/grant writer specialising in EU fundraising, scientific/business communication, and commercialization strategy—the urge to pursue innovation has always roots in my DNA. I have helped innovators secure >€23.4 million in non-diluted funding from H2020 and Horizon Europe. Also, I have led and advised over 15 EU-wide funding applications for highly innovative projects across various domains, including pharmaceutical, medical devices, and agri-food technology. Meanwhile, I have built an international network in 15 countries with >40 organizations. Besides my EU funding and commercialization expertise, I have a background (5+ years) in oncology and bone regeneration, leading to 5 publications. 

Professional training: Successful fund acquisition and grant writing, Business strategy training (Catalyze, NL), Communication and Acquisition (People Plus, NL), Business Concept (Innosuisse, CH), Drug Discovery and Development, ICH-GCP, Medical Device Regulation Basics, Biocompatible Materials, 3D Printing Specialization.

►Multilingual skills in Chinese (Native), English (C1-C2), Dutch (A2), and German (A1). 

Additional interests: Tooling with AI, Scientific illustration, Infographics, Business Drawing, Entrepreneurship, Fingerstyle Guitar

treasury_media.title: Certificate for Module2:Business Concept in Startup Campus, Switzerland.pdf
Popticlear, one of the top 10 business idea for next generation SLE therapeutics in Venture 2018 competition, Switzerland
treasury_media.description: With other three biomedical professionals, we founded "Popticlear" as a startup project to develop novel therapeutics to gives better lives for patients with a deteriorated autoimmune disease, named systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).

treasury_media.title: Europe-Taiwan Biotech Association (ETBA)
treasury_media.description:
ETBA aims to enhance the connections and collaborations between Taiwan and European countries in the areas of biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, and medical technology. 

We believe the advancements in these fields will contribute significantly to improve the qualities of life and make our planet a better place to live.

Currently, ETBA is run by two dedicated teams located in Switzerland and in Taiwan, serving our association members spreading across over 15 countries.

awards.title: Entrepreneurship Training: Business Concept (Innosuisse)
awards.description:
Selected participants acquire subject-specific skills that are critical to a startup’s success. They become familiar with the major challenges of a startup company and understand the challenges for entrepreneurs. They apply best practice from concrete examples, engage in meaningful group discussion and evaluation of participants’ projects and test the successful application of tools and skills learnt. The following topics have been taught and have additionally been completed with two individual coaching sessions and a final pitch in front of a jury for each project:
-	Idea
-	Market Relations
-	Finance
-	Resources
-	Ecosystem
-	Opportunity
-	Protection
-	Funding
-	Presentation
-	Pitching

projects.title: Popticlear - A start-up dedicated for next generation therapy for systemic lupus erythematosus
projects.description: In the human body, millions of cells commit suicide every second. The resultant cell corpses are cleaned up immediately by scavenger cells, which are specialists at removing unwanted things in the body. However, when cell corpses are not being removed efficiently, autoimmune diseases, such as systemic lupus erythematous (SLE), develop. This startup project aims at improving human well-being by developing specialised antibodies to bridge scavenger cells and the cell corpses, thereby enhancing corpse removal to provide a novel disease-modifying therapy for SLE.

profile_positions.description:
#Highlighted skillset and achievements:

- Spearheaded end-to-end process management and stakeholder engagement throughout the grant application cycle. That includes call evaluation, brainstorming, process guidance, content creation (co-write the content), and final submission, **leading to 3 awarded projects and >€15M awarded funding under Horizon Europe**.

- Pioneered the integration of innovative tools and methodologies to streamline workflows and boost operational efficiency, consistently seeking opportunities to enhance the team's work processes. This is demonstrated by **the introduction of Biorender and the adoption of generative AI tooling, such as ChatGPT and Midjouney**.

- Facilitated funding acquisition by disseminating vital information to researchers and proactively identifying suitable opportunities for targeted applications. Notably, I have built a strong rapport in the Regenerative Medicine Strategy Program at UMCU and collaborated closely with the program manager.
 
- Mentored researchers in crafting impactful proposals by assisting them in outlining and articulating the project's impact pathway, enhancing the project proposals' overall quality.

- Conducted comprehensive reviews of grant proposals, ensuring adherence to guidelines and enhancing the overall coherence and persuasiveness of submissions.
  
- Employed graphic design expertise to develop compelling illustrations, effectively translating complex project concepts into easily understandable visuals, bolstering the clarity of grant proposals.
profile_positions.title: Medior EU Grant Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Highlighted skillset and achievements:

• Excellent writing and strategic consulting skills, leading to successful fundraising of >€7 million from H2020 and >10 EU-wide funding applications.

• Experienced with H2020 scheme (BHC, EIC, FTI, Eurostars, Globalstars) and Wellcome Trust

• Proven business development skills, as evidenced by an extensive international network in 15 countries (incl. CH, NL, IT, BE, DE, FR, DK, SE, UK, FI, IL, RO, ES, IN, TU) with >40 organizations.

• Strong client management skills, contributing to the coordination of max. 22 partners to build a 4-year EU-wide project (H2020-HBC) with €15 million funding.

• Solid project management skill which helps the SME clients to coordinate with 4 international partners to formulate an award-winning project within 1 month (awarded €3 million prestigious FET-Open funding).

At Catalye, I help clients (SMEs and researchers) to get funding for biomedical and healthcare innovations. By doing so, I lower the thresholds to resources while increasing the chance for success and accelerating their R&D to make impact.
profile_positions.title: Consultant- Life Sciences, Biotechnology and Medical Technology

profile_positions.description:
Key Skills: Business Development (Lead Generation & Relationship Building) and Marketing Campaigns

• Executed a project to search for local partners in Switzerland for 1 TW medical implant company, resulting in 3 successful face-to-face business meetings and the generation of revenue for ETBA (nearly CHF3000). 
 
• Supported strategic partner outreach using strong interpersonal skills, establishing 2 partnership with Switzerland Global Enterprise and London Taiwanese Biomedical Society.

• Generated leads through conference calls, leading to 1 biotech corporate member to drive revenue and sustainable growth of ETBA.

• Performed marketing and operational activities (host workshops, online advertising, events co-promotion, and social media marketing) to promote ETBA visibility, resulting in 3 career workshops (with initial revenue of CHF 1000) and 3 MOUs with partners.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer (Volunteer)

profile_positions.description:
Key Skills: people skills, business acumen

• Industry training platform to prepare academics for industry careers
• Acquired broad-range of industry-related knowledge, such as functional roles, cross-functional collaboration, lead generation in sales etc.
• Fostered relationships with industry professionals (Pharma, Biotech, VC).
• Exchange experience with fellow associates to facilitate the transition process into industrial positions.
profile_positions.title: Associate

profile_positions.description:
Area of Expertise: 
Bone Regenerative Medicine, Novel small molecule-based therapeutics (Bromodomain inhibitors), Customizable bioactive implants (tricalcium phosphate & bioglass ceramic).

Key Skills: Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills, Project Management, Scientific Communication, Interpersonal Skills

• Managed 2 projects with excellent time management and organizational skills, resulting in 3 publications regarding implant design guidelines and the application of epigenetic drugs in bone repair.

• Presented scientific discoveries to 200+ audiences in molecular biology and bone tissue engineering with excellent communication skills, as demonstrated by 8+ selected presentations.

• Documented detailed protocols and research for cross-functional communication with stakeholders at various levels, including team leaders, lab managers, postdoc, scientists in core facilities, fellow researchers, and technicians.

• Utilised strong analytical skills to study the mechanism of action (MOA) of two small molecules therapeutics (NMP and DMA) for inflammatory bone disorders as a new indication.

• Trained and advised 2 junior PhD students on problem-solving and critical thinking regarding their research projects and thesis.

• Contributed to 30-50% cost reduction on laboratory consumables with negotiation skills.
profile_positions.title: Research Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Area of Expertise: Pathogenesis of SLE
Key Skills: Business Awareness, Influencing Skills, Communication, Project Management

Can you imagine a life in which you cannot be exposed to the sun anymore? or in which you have to constantly worry about disease flare that will jeopardize your life and cause burdens on your families?

Unfortunately, this is the status quo for patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), a debilitating autoimmune disease with no satisfactory therapies available in the market.

Popticlear is a start-up project to develop a therapeutics that fine-tunes endogenous dead cell clearance system to make SLE patients live better and colorful lives again!

As a co-founder, I

• Founded and led the team with excellent business acumen, leading to an award-winning start-up for treating systemic lupus erythematosus (Top 10 business idea out of 109 start-ups in Swiss >>Venture>> 2018;  Finalist in Oxford PanaceaStar accelerator).

• Performed market/risks analysis, identified the competitive advantages, and devised de-risk/funding strategies, leading to a concrete business plan.

• Demonstrated strong entrepreneurial spirit with experience in long-distance collaboration and cross-functional communication.

• Consolidated a five-year milestone plan with strong strategic planning skills, aiming to develop a purposed therapeutics from proof-of-concept to the first-in-human trial.

• Built rapport using people skills with top VC firms (i.e., Strategic venture capital from Novartis Pharma), angel investors, CRO, and patent lawyers, resulting in a robust professional network.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
• Directed a project to analysed radiation-damaged salivary gland to uncover the cell population with high regenerative capacity as source of cell therapy for salivary gland reconstruction in cancer patients.

• Drafted and summarised reports for effectively communicating with key stakeholders about the latest progress in weekly meetings.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant in Regenerative Medicine and Tissue Engineering Lab

profile_positions.description:
• Liaised effectively with personnel at various management levels both inter- and intra-hospitals, in a high paced environment, to reduce communication errors and to facilitate operational efficiency.

• Coordinated with emergency room (ER) and various clinics to timely complete 40+ inter-hospital transfer for critical-conditioned patients.

• Negotiated with superiors to prevent work overload of 30+ junior substitute civilian serviceman and 3 fellow corporals, resulting in an increased productivity and better commitment.
profile_positions.title: Medical corporal

profile_positions.description: • Advised 1 master student on a pilot research project which contributes to 1 publication in EMBO journal.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant in Institute of Biological Chemistry

profile_positions.description:
• Led a pilot project named “KLHL39 functions as a negative regulator of the Cullin3-KLHL20 ubiquitin E3 Ligase”, resulting in 1 publication on the high-impact journal of oncology.

• Discovered a new regulatory mechanism fine-tuning the degradation capacity of specific E3 ligase on a well-known tumour suppressor, PML. This research unveiled a mechanism of action that can be targeted to treat colon cancer.

• Successfully generated WT/mutant of protein (consisted of 5 distinct KLHL39 mutants) expression constructs, changed tags (consisted 6 types of tags) for protein, established stable KLHL39 knockdown cell lines (generated 3 different lines in Hela cells).

• Optimised In Vitro ubiquitination assay, increased >40%  efficiency in monitoring the Cullin3-KLHL20 E3 Ligase activity under ND1-treated condition.

• Improved the quality and quantity of purified recombinant KLHL39. (purified 50% more than original purification protocol)
profile_positions.title: Masters Student in Department of Molecular Medicine

profile_positions.description:
- Led and conducted a pilot project for bachelor thesis "Characterization of functions and expression of orphan Chemokine CXCL14”, leading to 1 national science council undergraduate research fellowship and 1 best poster award.

- Successfully established CXCL14 gene expression profiles (screened 22 types of rat tissues, 14 time points in rat ovarian cycle, and 3 different ovarian compartments). 

- Demonstrated that CXCL14 triggers signaling that can change the morphology of human monocytic leukemia-derived cells from the suspended to attached nature and guided the differentiation of macrophage-like cells towards classical pro-inflammatory M1 macrophages.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Intern Student in Department of Life Science

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Conceptualized and developed an IT strategy for digital marketing (social media, digitally-designed logo) and online payment system as a resourceful problem-solver, creating the very first revenue for the association. 

• Supported strategic partner outreach using strong interpersonal skills, establishing 2 partnership with Switzerland Global Enterprise and London Taiwanese Biomedical Society.

• Performed marketing and operational activities (host workshops, online advertising, events co-promotion, and social media marketing) to promote ETBA visibility, resulting in 3 career workshops (with initial revenue of CHF 1k) and 3 MOUs with partners.
